alert.note: Alert for Norman; West Marshall; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:55PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Marshall, northwestern Norman, western Polk, eastern Grand Forks and central Traill Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Poland to Blanchard. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. Wind gusts will likely precede arriving thunderstorms. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oslo and Alvarado around 1205 AM CDT. Cummings around 1210 AM CDT. Caledonia and Buxton around 1215 AM CDT. Argyle and Nielsville around 1220 AM CDT. Climax around 1225 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Grand Forks Airport and American Crystal Sugar. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 100 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
